params.taskDescription:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mtext>~</mtext>
  <mi>p</mi>
  <mo stretchy="false">→<!-- → --></mo>
  <mi>q</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">\text{~}p \to q</annotation></semantics></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>q</mi>
  <mo stretchy="false">→<!-- → --></mo>
  <mtext>~</mtext>
  <mi>r</mi>
  <mo>.</mo>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">q \to \text~r.</annotation></semantics></math>

params.taskDescription: If Mr. Spock is a science officer, then Montgomery Scott is an engineer.  If Montgomery Scott is an engineer, then James T. Kirk is the captain.

params.taskDescription: If Prince Charles is a character from Star Wars, then Luke Skywalker is not a Jedi. If Luke Skywalker is not a Jedi, then Darth Vader is not his father.

questionSetStimulus: For the following exercises, each pair of statements represent true premises in a logical argument. Based on these premises, apply the chain rule for conditional arguments to determine a valid and sound conclusion.
